+++ b/_english-version/git/export-git-repos.ps1
@@ -0,0 +1,424 @@
+# ============================================================================
+# Script: export-git-repos.ps1
+# Description: Searches for Git repos in a folder, identifies remote/branch
+#              and generates a script to clone the structure on another computer
+# ============================================================================
+
+param(
+    [string]$Path,
+    [string]$Output,
+    [switch]$Help
+)
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Helper Functions
+# ============================================================================
+
+function Write-Step {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üöÄ $Message" -ForegroundColor White
+}
+
+function Write-Info {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üîç $Message" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+}
+
+function Write-Success {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "‚úÖ $Message" -ForegroundColor Green
+}
+
+function Write-Warn {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è $Message" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+}
+
+function Write-Err {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "‚ùå $Message" -ForegroundColor Red
+}
+
+function Write-Install {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üì¶ $Message" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+}
+
+function Write-Update {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üîÑ $Message" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+}
+
+# Script directory
+$ScriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Path
+
+# Tracking arrays
+$script:ReposFound = @()
+$script:ReposNoRemote = @()
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Functions
+# ============================================================================
+
+function Show-Usage {
+    Write-Host "Usage: .\export-git-repos.ps1 [options]"
+    Write-Host ""
+    Write-Host "Options:"
+    Write-Host "  -Path PATH       Root folder to search for repos (default: current directory)"
+    Write-Host "  -Output FILE     Output file for the script (default: clone-repos.ps1)"
+    Write-Host "  -Help            Show this help"
+    Write-Host ""
+    Write-Host "Examples:"
+    Write-Host "  .\export-git-repos.ps1 -Path C:\Projects"
+    Write-Host "  .\export-git-repos.ps1 -Path D:\Repos -Output my-repos.ps1"
+}
+
+function Test-Prerequisites {
+    Write-Info "Checking prerequisites..."
+    
+    if (-not (Get-Command "git" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) {
+        Write-Err "Git not found. Please install Git first."
+        exit 1
+    }
+    
+    Write-Success "Prerequisites OK"
+}
+
+function Get-SearchPath {
+    param([string]$InputPath)
+    
+    if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($InputPath)) {
+        $InputPath = Read-Host "üìÅ Root folder to search for repos [$(Get-Location)]"
+        if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($InputPath)) {
+            $InputPath = (Get-Location).Path
+        }
+    }
+    
+    # Resolve absolute path
+    try {
+        $resolvedPath = (Resolve-Path -Path $InputPath -ErrorAction Stop).Path
+    }
+    catch {
+        Write-Err "Folder not found: $InputPath"
+        exit 1
+    }
+    
+    if (-not (Test-Path $resolvedPath -PathType Container)) {
+        Write-Err "Folder not found: $InputPath"
+        exit 1
+    }
+    
+    Write-Info "Search folder: $resolvedPath"
+    return $resolvedPath
+}
+
+function Get-OutputFile {
+    param([string]$InputFile)
+    
+    if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($InputFile)) {
+        $InputFile = Read-Host "üìÑ Output file name [clone-repos.ps1]"
+        if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($InputFile)) {
+            $InputFile = "clone-repos.ps1"
+        }
+    }
+    
+    # Ensure .ps1 extension
+    if (-not $InputFile.EndsWith(".ps1")) {
+        $InputFile = "$InputFile.ps1"
+    }
+    
+    Write-Info "Output file: $InputFile"
+    return $InputFile
+}
+
+function Get-RepoInfo {
+    param([string]$RepoPath)
+    
+    $originalLocation = Get-Location
+    Set-Location $RepoPath
+    
+    try {
+        $remoteUrl = git remote get-url origin 2>$null
+        $currentBranch = git branch --show-current 2>$null
+        
+        if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($currentBranch)) {
+            $currentBranch = git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD 2>$null
+            if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($currentBranch)) {
+                $currentBranch = "main"
+            }
+        }
+    }
+    catch {
+        $remoteUrl = ""
+        $currentBranch = "main"
+    }
+    
+    Set-Location $originalLocation
+    
+    return @{
+        RemoteUrl = $remoteUrl
+        Branch = $currentBranch
+    }
+}
+
+function Find-AllRepos {
+    param([string]$SearchPath)
+    
+    Write-Step "Searching for Git repositories recursively..."
+    Write-Host ""
+    
+    # Search all .git directories recursively
+    $gitDirs = Get-ChildItem -Path $SearchPath -Directory -Recurse -Filter ".git" -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
+    
+    $total = $gitDirs.Count
+    Write-Info "Found $total Git repositories"
+    Write-Host ""
+    
+    $current = 0
+    foreach ($gitDir in $gitDirs) {
+        $current++
+        $repoPath = $gitDir.Parent.FullName
+        
+        # Path relative to search folder
+        $relativePath = $repoPath.Substring($SearchPath.Length).TrimStart('\', '/')
+        
+        # Get repo info
+        $repoInfo = Get-RepoInfo -RepoPath $repoPath
+        
+        Write-Host "[$current/$total] " -ForegroundColor Cyan -NoNewline
+        Write-Host $relativePath
+        
+        if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($repoInfo.RemoteUrl)) {
+            Write-Warn "  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No remote origin (skipped)"
+            $script:ReposNoRemote += $relativePath
+        }
+        else {
+            Write-Host "  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Remote: $($repoInfo.RemoteUrl)"
+            Write-Host "  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Branch: $($repoInfo.Branch)"
+            $script:ReposFound += @{
+                RelativePath = $relativePath
+                RemoteUrl = $repoInfo.RemoteUrl
+                Branch = $repoInfo.Branch
+            }
+        }
+    }
+}
+
+function New-CloneScript {
+    param([string]$OutputFile, [string]$SearchPath)
+    
+    Write-Host ""
+    Write-Step "Generating clone script..."
+    
+    # Generated script header
+    $scriptContent = @'
+# ============================================================================
+# Script: clone-repos.ps1 (auto-generated)
+# Description: Clones Git repositories preserving original folder structure
+# ============================================================================
+
+param(
+    [string]$BaseDir = (Get-Location).Path
+)
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Helper Functions
+# ============================================================================
+
+function Write-Step {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üöÄ $Message" -ForegroundColor White
+}
+
+function Write-Info {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üîç $Message" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+}
+
+function Write-Success {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "‚úÖ $Message" -ForegroundColor Green
+}
+
+function Write-Warn {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è $Message" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+}
+
+function Write-Err {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "‚ùå $Message" -ForegroundColor Red
+}
+
+function Write-Install {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üì¶ $Message" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+}
+
+function Write-Update {
+    param([string]$Message)
+    Write-Host "üîÑ $Message" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+}
+
+# Tracking
+$script:ReposCloned = @()
+$script:ReposSkipped = @()
+$script:ReposFailed = @()
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Functions
+# ============================================================================
+
+function Invoke-CloneRepo {
+    param(
+        [string]$RelativePath,
+        [string]$RemoteUrl,
+        [string]$Branch
+    )
+    
+    $targetDir = Join-Path $BaseDir $RelativePath
+    
+    if (Test-Path (Join-Path $targetDir ".git")) {
+        Write-Warn "Repo already exists: $RelativePath"
+        $script:ReposSkipped += $RelativePath
+        return
+    }
+    
+    Write-Install "Cloning: $RelativePath"
+    Write-Host "  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ URL: $RemoteUrl"
+    Write-Host "  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Branch: $Branch"
+    
+    # Create parent folder if it doesn't exist
+    $parentDir = Split-Path -Parent $targetDir
+    if (-not (Test-Path $parentDir)) {
+        New-Item -Path $parentDir -ItemType Directory -Force | Out-Null
+    }
+    
+    # Try to clone with specific branch
+    $result = git clone --branch $Branch $RemoteUrl $targetDir 2>&1
+    if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
+        Write-Success "Cloned: $RelativePath"
+        $script:ReposCloned += $RelativePath
+    }
+    else {
+        # Try without specific branch
+        $result = git clone $RemoteUrl $targetDir 2>&1
+        if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
+            Write-Warn "Cloned (default branch): $RelativePath"
+            $script:ReposCloned += $RelativePath
+        }
+        else {
+            Write-Err "Failed to clone: $RelativePath"
+            $script:ReposFailed += $RelativePath
+        }
+    }
+}
+
+function Show-Summary {
+    Write-Host ""
+    Write-Host "============================================================================"
+    Write-Host " Summary"
+    Write-Host "============================================================================"
+    
+    if ($script:ReposCloned.Count -gt 0) {
+        Write-Success "Cloned: $($script:ReposCloned.Count)"
+    }
+    
+    if ($script:ReposSkipped.Count -gt 0) {
+        Write-Warn "Already existing: $($script:ReposSkipped.Count)"
+    }
+    
+    if ($script:ReposFailed.Count -gt 0) {
+        Write-Err "Failed: $($script:ReposFailed.Count)"
+        foreach ($repo in $script:ReposFailed) {
+            Write-Host "  - $repo"
+        }
+    }
+}
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Main
+# ============================================================================
+
+function Main {
+    Write-Step "Cloning repositories to: $BaseDir"
+    Write-Host ""
+
+'@
+
+    # Add metadata
+    $scriptContent += "`n# Generated on: $(Get-Date -Format 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss')`n"
+    $scriptContent += "# Original folder: $SearchPath`n"
+    $scriptContent += "# Total repositories: $($script:ReposFound.Count)`n`n"
+    
+    # Add clone calls for each repo
+    foreach ($repo in $script:ReposFound) {
+        $scriptContent += "    Invoke-CloneRepo -RelativePath `"$($repo.RelativePath)`" -RemoteUrl `"$($repo.RemoteUrl)`" -Branch `"$($repo.Branch)`"`n"
+    }
+    
+    # Script footer
+    $scriptContent += @'
+
+    Show-Summary
+}
+
+Main
+'@
+
+    # Save file
+    $scriptContent | Out-File -FilePath $OutputFile -Encoding utf8
+}
+
+function Show-Summary {
+    Write-Host ""
+    Write-Host "============================================================================"
+    Write-Host " Summary"
+    Write-Host "============================================================================"
+    
+    Write-Success "Repositories found: $($script:ReposFound.Count)"
+    
+    if ($script:ReposNoRemote.Count -gt 0) {
+        Write-Warn "No remote (skipped): $($script:ReposNoRemote.Count)"
+        foreach ($repo in $script:ReposNoRemote) {
+            Write-Host "  - $repo"
+        }
+    }
+    
+    Write-Host ""
+    Write-Success "Script generated: $script:OutputFile"
+    Write-Host ""
+    Write-Info "To use on another computer:"
+    Write-Host "    1. Copy the file '$script:OutputFile' to the destination"
+    Write-Host "    2. Run: .\$script:OutputFile -BaseDir [target_folder]"
+}
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Main
+# ============================================================================
+
+function Main {
+    Write-Step "Git Repository Exporter"
+    Write-Host ""
+    
+    if ($Help) {
+        Show-Usage
+        exit 0
+    }
+    
+    Test-Prerequisites
+    $script:SearchPath = Get-SearchPath -InputPath $Path
+    $script:OutputFile = Get-OutputFile -InputFile $Output
+    Write-Host ""
+    
+    Find-AllRepos -SearchPath $script:SearchPath
+    
+    if ($script:ReposFound.Count -eq 0) {
+        Write-Warn "No repository with remote origin found."
+        exit 0
+    }
+    
+    New-CloneScript -OutputFile $script:OutputFile -SearchPath $script:SearchPath
+    Show-Summary
+}
+
+Main

+#!/bin/bash
+set -euo pipefail
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Script: export-git-repos.sh

+# ============================================================================
+

+CYAN='\033[0;36m'
+WHITE='\033[1;37m'

+print_info()    { echo -e "${CYAN}üîç $1${NC}"; }
+print_success() { echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ $1${NC}"; }
+print_warning() { echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è $1${NC}"; }
+print_error()   { echo -e "${RED}‚ùå $1${NC}"; }
+print_step()    { echo -e "${WHITE}üöÄ $1${NC}"; }
+print_install() { echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ $1${NC}"; }

+SEARCH_PATH=""
+OUTPUT_FILE=""

+# Tracking arrays
+REPOS_FOUND=()
+REPOS_NO_REMOTE=()
+
+# Error handling
+trap 'print_error "Error on line $LINENO"; exit 1' ERR
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Functions
+# ============================================================================
+
+show_usage() {
+    echo "Usage: $0 [options]"
+    echo ""
+    echo "Options:"
+    echo "  -p, --path PATH      Root folder to search for repos (default: current directory)"
+    echo "  -o, --output FILE    Output file for the script (default: clone-repos.sh)"
+    echo "  -h, --help           Show this help"
+    echo ""
+    echo "Examples:"
+    echo "  $0 -p ~/projects"
+    echo "  $0 -p /home/user/repos -o my-repos.sh"
+}
+
+parse_arguments() {
+    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
+        case "$1" in
+            -p|--path)
+                SEARCH_PATH="$2"
+                shift 2
+                ;;
+            -o|--output)
+                OUTPUT_FILE="$2"
+                shift 2
+                ;;
+            -h|--help)
+                show_usage
+                exit 0
+                ;;
+            *)
+                print_error "Unknown option: $1"
+                show_usage
+                exit 1
+                ;;
+        esac
+    done
+}
+
+check_prerequisites() {
+    print_info "Checking prerequisites..."
+    
+    if ! command -v git &>/dev/null; then
+        print_error "Git not found. Please install Git first."
+        exit 1
+    fi
+    
+    if ! command -v find &>/dev/null; then
+        print_error "find not found."
+        exit 1
+    fi
+    
+    print_success "Prerequisites OK"
+}
+
+get_search_path() {
+    if [[ -z "$SEARCH_PATH" ]]; then
+        read -p "üìÅ Root folder to search for repos [$(pwd)]: " SEARCH_PATH
+        SEARCH_PATH="${SEARCH_PATH:-$(pwd)}"
+    fi
+    
+    # Expand ~ and convert to absolute path
+    SEARCH_PATH=$(realpath -m "$SEARCH_PATH")
+    
+    if [[ ! -d "$SEARCH_PATH" ]]; then
+        print_error "Folder not found: $SEARCH_PATH"
+        exit 1
+    fi
+    
+    print_info "Search folder: $SEARCH_PATH"
+}
+
+get_output_file() {
+    if [[ -z "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
+        read -p "üìÑ Output file name [clone-repos.sh]: " OUTPUT_FILE
+        OUTPUT_FILE="${OUTPUT_FILE:-clone-repos.sh}"
+    fi
+    
+    # Ensure .sh extension
+    if [[ "$OUTPUT_FILE" != *.sh ]]; then
+        OUTPUT_FILE="${OUTPUT_FILE}.sh"
+    fi
+    
+    print_info "Output file: $OUTPUT_FILE"
+}
+
+get_repo_info() {
+    local repo_path="$1"
+    local remote_url=""
+    local current_branch=""
+    
+    # Save current directory
+    local original_dir="$PWD"
+    
+    # Enter repo directory
+    cd "$repo_path"
+    
+    # Get origin remote URL
+    remote_url=$(git remote get-url origin 2>/dev/null || echo "")
+    
+    # Get current branch
+    current_branch=$(git branch --show-current 2>/dev/null || echo "")
+    
+    # If no current branch, try to get HEAD
+    if [[ -z "$current_branch" ]]; then
+        current_branch=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "main")
+    fi
+    
+    # Return to original directory
+    cd "$original_dir"
+    
+    echo "$remote_url|$current_branch"
+}
+
+find_all_repos() {
+    local search_path="$1"
+    
+    print_step "Searching for Git repositories recursively..."
+    echo ""
+    
+    # Use mapfile to capture all results correctly
+    local git_dirs=()
+    while IFS= read -r -d '' git_dir; do
+        git_dirs+=("$(dirname "$git_dir")")
+    done < <(find "$search_path" -type d -name ".git" -print0 2>/dev/null)
+    
+    local total=${#git_dirs[@]}
+    print_info "Found $total Git repositories"
+    echo ""
+    
+    # Process each repository
+    local current=0
+    for repo_path in "${git_dirs[@]}"; do
+        ((current++))
+        
+        # Path relative to search folder
+        local relative_path="${repo_path#$search_path/}"
+        
+        # Get repo info
+        local repo_info
+        repo_info=$(get_repo_info "$repo_path")
+        
+        local remote_url="${repo_info%%|*}"
+        local branch="${repo_info##*|}"
+        
+        echo -e "${CYAN}[$current/$total]${NC} $relative_path"
+        
+        if [[ -z "$remote_url" ]]; then
+            print_warning "  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ No remote origin (skipped)"
+            REPOS_NO_REMOTE+=("$relative_path")
+        else
+            echo "  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Remote: $remote_url"
+            echo "  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Branch: $branch"
+            REPOS_FOUND+=("$relative_path|$remote_url|$branch")
+        fi
+    done
+}
+
+generate_clone_script() {
+    local output_file="$1"
+

+    print_step "Generating clone script..."
+

+    cat > "$output_file" << 'HEADER'
+#!/bin/bash

+
+# ============================================================================
+# Script: clone-repos.sh (auto-generated)
+# Description: Clones Git repositories preserving original folder structure
+# ============================================================================
+
+# Colors
+RED='\033[0;31m'
+GREEN='\033[0;32m'
+YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
+CYAN='\033[0;36m'
+WHITE='\033[1;37m'
+NC='\033[0m'
+
+# Helpers
+print_info()    { echo -e "${CYAN}üîç $1${NC}"; }
+print_success() { echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ $1${NC}"; }
+print_warning() { echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è $1${NC}"; }
+print_error()   { echo -e "${RED}‚ùå $1${NC}"; }
+print_step()    { echo -e "${WHITE}üöÄ $1${NC}"; }
+print_install() { echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ $1${NC}"; }
+print_update()  { echo -e "${CYAN}üîÑ $1${NC}"; }
+
+# Tracking
+REPOS_CLONED=()
+REPOS_SKIPPED=()
+REPOS_FAILED=()
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Configuration
+# ============================================================================
+
+BASE_DIR="${1:-$(pwd)}"
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Functions
+# ============================================================================
+
+clone_repo() {
+    local relative_path="$1"
+    local remote_url="$2"
+    local branch="$3"
+    
+    local target_dir="$BASE_DIR/$relative_path"
+    
+    if [[ -d "$target_dir/.git" ]]; then
+        print_warning "Repo already exists: $relative_path"
+        REPOS_SKIPPED+=("$relative_path")
+        return 0
+    fi
+    
+    print_install "Cloning: $relative_path"
+    echo "  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ URL: $remote_url"
+    echo "  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Branch: $branch"
+    
+    # Create parent folder if it doesn't exist
+    mkdir -p "$(dirname "$target_dir")"
+    
+    # Try to clone with specific branch
+    if git clone --branch "$branch" "$remote_url" "$target_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
+        print_success "Cloned: $relative_path"
+        REPOS_CLONED+=("$relative_path")
+    else
+        # Try without specific branch
+        if git clone "$remote_url" "$target_dir" 2>/dev/null; then
+            print_warning "Cloned (default branch): $relative_path"
+            REPOS_CLONED+=("$relative_path")
+        else
+            print_error "Failed to clone: $relative_path"
+            REPOS_FAILED+=("$relative_path")
+            return 1
+        fi
+    fi
+}
+
+show_summary() {
+    echo ""
+    echo "============================================================================"
+    echo " Summary"
+    echo "============================================================================"
+    
+    if [[ ${#REPOS_CLONED[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
+        print_success "Cloned: ${#REPOS_CLONED[@]}"
+    fi
+    
+    if [[ ${#REPOS_SKIPPED[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
+        print_warning "Already existing: ${#REPOS_SKIPPED[@]}"
+    fi
+    
+    if [[ ${#REPOS_FAILED[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
+        print_error "Failed: ${#REPOS_FAILED[@]}"
+        for repo in "${REPOS_FAILED[@]}"; do
+            echo "  - $repo"
+        done
+    fi
+}
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Main
+# ============================================================================
+
+main() {
+    print_step "Cloning repositories to: $BASE_DIR"
+    echo ""
+
+HEADER
+
+    # Add metadata
+    echo "# Generated on: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" >> "$output_file"
+    echo "# Original folder: $SEARCH_PATH" >> "$output_file"
+    echo "# Total repositories: ${#REPOS_FOUND[@]}" >> "$output_file"
+    echo "" >> "$output_file"
+    
+    # Add clone calls for each repo
+    for repo_data in "${REPOS_FOUND[@]}"; do
+        local relative_path="${repo_data%%|*}"
+        local temp="${repo_data#*|}"
+        local remote_url="${temp%%|*}"
+        local branch="${temp##*|}"
+        
+        echo "    clone_repo \"$relative_path\" \"$remote_url\" \"$branch\"" >> "$output_file"
+    done
+    
+    # Script footer
+    cat >> "$output_file" << 'FOOTER'
+
+    show_summary
+}
+
+main
+FOOTER
+
+    # Make executable
+    chmod +x "$output_file"
+}
+
+show_summary() {
+    echo ""
+    echo "============================================================================"
+    echo " Summary"
+    echo "============================================================================"
+    
+    print_success "Repositories found: ${#REPOS_FOUND[@]}"
+    
+    if [[ ${#REPOS_NO_REMOTE[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
+        print_warning "No remote (skipped): ${#REPOS_NO_REMOTE[@]}"
+        for repo in "${REPOS_NO_REMOTE[@]}"; do
+            echo "  - $repo"
+        done
+    fi
+    
+    echo ""
+    print_success "Script generated: $OUTPUT_FILE"
+    echo ""
+    print_info "To use on another computer:"
+    echo "    1. Copy the file '$OUTPUT_FILE' to the destination"
+    echo "    2. Run: ./$OUTPUT_FILE [target_folder]"
+}
+
+# ============================================================================
+# Main
+# ============================================================================
+
+main() {
+    print_step "Git Repository Exporter"
+    echo ""
+    
+    parse_arguments "$@"
+    check_prerequisites
+    get_search_path
+    get_output_file
+    echo ""
+    
+    find_all_repos "$SEARCH_PATH"
+    
+    if [[ ${#REPOS_FOUND[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
+        print_warning "No repository with remote origin found."
+        exit 0
+    fi
+    
+    generate_clone_script "$OUTPUT_FILE"
+    show_summary
+}
+
+main "$@"

# üé® Oh My Posh Scripts

Scripts for installing and configuring Oh My Posh with a custom theme.

## üìã Available Scripts

### `install-omp-theme.ps1` (Windows)

Installs Oh My Posh and configures the custom theme on Windows.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Installs Oh My Posh via winget (if not installed)
- ‚úÖ Updates Oh My Posh (if already installed)
- ‚úÖ Downloads the custom theme
- ‚úÖ Automatically configures the PowerShell profile

**Usage:**
```powershell
.\install-omp-theme.ps1
```

---

### `install-omp-theme.sh` (Linux/Ubuntu)

Installs Oh My Posh and configures the custom theme on Linux.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Installs Oh My Posh via curl (if not installed)
- ‚úÖ Updates Oh My Posh (if already installed)
- ‚úÖ Downloads the custom theme
- ‚úÖ Detects shell (bash/zsh) and configures the correct profile

**Usage:**
```bash
chmod +x install-omp-theme.sh
./install-omp-theme.sh
```

---

### `install-omp-theme-mac.sh` (macOS)

Installs Oh My Posh and configures the custom theme on macOS.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Checks if Homebrew is installed
- ‚úÖ Installs Oh My Posh via Homebrew (if not installed)
- ‚úÖ Updates Oh My Posh (if already installed)

+**Theme features:**

#!/bin/bash
# Script to install custom Oh My Posh theme on macOS
# Author: GitHub Copilot

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo -e "${CYAN}üé® Installing custom Oh My Posh theme...${NC}"

# Check if Homebrew is installed
if ! command -v brew &> /dev/null; then
    exit 1
fi

# Check if Oh My Posh is installed
echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Checking Oh My Posh installation...${NC}"

if ! command -v oh-my-posh &> /dev/null; then
    fi
else
    fi
fi

# Script directory (where the local theme is)
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
LOCAL_THEME_FILE="${SCRIPT_DIR}/blocks.emoji.omp.json"

# Oh My Posh themes directory
THEMES_PATH="${HOME}/.poshthemes"

# Theme file name
THEME_NAME="blocks.emoji.omp.json"
THEME_FILE_PATH="${THEMES_PATH}/${THEME_NAME}"

echo -e "${YELLOW}üìÅ Themes directory: ${THEMES_PATH}${NC}"

# Create directory if it doesn't exist

    mkdir -p "$THEMES_PATH"
fi

# Copy local theme
if [ -f "$LOCAL_THEME_FILE" ]; then
    fi
else
    exit 1
fi

+#!/bin/bash
+# Script to install custom Oh My Posh theme on macOS
+# Author: GitHub Copilot
+# Date: 2026-01-15
+
+# Colors for output
+RED='\033[0;31m'
+GREEN='\033[0;32m'
+YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
+CYAN='\033[0;36m'
+NC='\033[0m' # No Color
+
+echo -e "${CYAN}üé® Installing custom Oh My Posh theme...${NC}"
+
+# Check if Homebrew is installed
+if ! command -v brew &> /dev/null; then
+    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Homebrew is not installed!${NC}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Please install Homebrew first:${NC}"
+    echo -e "   /bin/bash -c \"\$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)\""
+    exit 1
+fi
+
+# Check if Oh My Posh is installed
+echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Checking Oh My Posh installation...${NC}"
+
+if ! command -v oh-my-posh &> /dev/null; then
+    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Oh My Posh is not installed!${NC}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing Oh My Posh via Homebrew...${NC}"
+    
+    if brew install jandedobbeleer/oh-my-posh/oh-my-posh; then
+        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh installed successfully!${NC}"
+        echo -e "${CYAN}üí° You may need to restart the terminal to use Oh My Posh${NC}"
+    else
+        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error installing Oh My Posh${NC}"
+        echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Try installing manually: brew install jandedobbeleer/oh-my-posh/oh-my-posh${NC}"
+        exit 1
+    fi
+else
+    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh is already installed${NC}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Updating Oh My Posh...${NC}"
+    
+    if sudo oh-my-posh upgrade --force; then
+        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh updated successfully!${NC}"
+    else
+        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Could not update, but continuing with current version${NC}"
+    fi
+fi
+
+# Script directory (where the local theme is)
+SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
+LOCAL_THEME_FILE="${SCRIPT_DIR}/blocks.emoji.omp.json"
+
+# Oh My Posh themes directory
+THEMES_PATH="${HOME}/.poshthemes"
+
+# Theme file name
+THEME_NAME="blocks.emoji.omp.json"
+THEME_FILE_PATH="${THEMES_PATH}/${THEME_NAME}"
+
+echo -e "${YELLOW}üìÅ Themes directory: ${THEMES_PATH}${NC}"
+
+# Create directory if it doesn't exist
+if [ ! -d "$THEMES_PATH" ]; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìÇ Creating themes directory...${NC}"
+    mkdir -p "$THEMES_PATH"
+fi
+
+# Copy local theme
+if [ -f "$LOCAL_THEME_FILE" ]; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Copying local theme...${NC}"
+    if cp "$LOCAL_THEME_FILE" "$THEME_FILE_PATH"; then
+        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Theme copied successfully: ${THEME_FILE_PATH}${NC}"
+    else
+        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error copying theme${NC}"
+        exit 1
+    fi
+else
+    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Theme file not found: ${LOCAL_THEME_FILE}${NC}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Make sure to run the script from the correct directory${NC}"
+    exit 1
+fi
+
+# Detect shell (bash or zsh)
+SHELL_NAME=$(basename "$SHELL")
+if [ "$SHELL_NAME" = "zsh" ]; then
+    PROFILE_FILE="${HOME}/.zshrc"
+    INIT_COMMAND="eval \"\$(oh-my-posh init zsh --config ${THEME_FILE_PATH})\""
+else
+    PROFILE_FILE="${HOME}/.bash_profile"
+    INIT_COMMAND="eval \"\$(oh-my-posh init bash --config ${THEME_FILE_PATH})\""
+fi
+
+echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Configuring profile: ${PROFILE_FILE}${NC}"
+
+# Create profile if it doesn't exist
+if [ ! -f "$PROFILE_FILE" ]; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Creating profile file...${NC}"
+    touch "$PROFILE_FILE"
+fi
+
+# Detect where Oh My Posh is installed (Homebrew installs in different locations)
+OMP_INSTALL_DIR=""
+if [ -f "/opt/homebrew/bin/oh-my-posh" ]; then
+    OMP_INSTALL_DIR="/opt/homebrew/bin"
+elif [ -f "/usr/local/bin/oh-my-posh" ]; then
+    OMP_INSTALL_DIR="/usr/local/bin"
+elif [ -f "${HOME}/.local/bin/oh-my-posh" ]; then
+    OMP_INSTALL_DIR="${HOME}/.local/bin"
+fi
+
+# Command to add to PATH (if needed)
+PATH_COMMAND=""
+if [ -n "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" ]; then
+    if [ "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" = "${HOME}/.local/bin" ]; then
+        PATH_COMMAND="export PATH=\"\$HOME/.local/bin:\$PATH\""
+    elif [ "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" = "/opt/homebrew/bin" ]; then
+        PATH_COMMAND="export PATH=\"/opt/homebrew/bin:\$PATH\""
+    fi
+fi
+
+# Check if Oh My Posh configuration already exists
+if grep -q "oh-my-posh init" "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Updating existing Oh My Posh configuration in profile...${NC}"
+    
+    # Remove old oh-my-posh lines (macOS sed -i syntax)
+    sed -i '' '/oh-my-posh init/d' "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    
+    # Add PATH if needed and not already present
+    if [ -n "$PATH_COMMAND" ]; then
+        if [ "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" = "${HOME}/.local/bin" ] && ! grep -q '\.local/bin' "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+            echo -e "${YELLOW}üìç Adding ~/.local/bin to PATH...${NC}"
+            echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "# Oh My Posh - PATH" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "$PATH_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        elif [ "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" = "/opt/homebrew/bin" ] && ! grep -q '/opt/homebrew/bin' "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+            echo -e "${YELLOW}üìç Adding /opt/homebrew/bin to PATH...${NC}"
+            echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "# Oh My Posh - PATH" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "$PATH_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        fi
+    fi
+    
+    # Add new configuration
+    echo "$INIT_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    
+    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh configuration updated in profile${NC}"
+else
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ûï Adding Oh My Posh to profile...${NC}"
+    
+    # Add blank line if file is not empty
+    if [ -s "$PROFILE_FILE" ]; then
+        echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    fi
+    
+    # Add PATH if needed and not already present
+    if [ -n "$PATH_COMMAND" ]; then
+        if [ "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" = "${HOME}/.local/bin" ] && ! grep -q '\.local/bin' "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+            echo -e "${YELLOW}üìç Adding ~/.local/bin to PATH...${NC}"
+            echo "# Oh My Posh - PATH" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "$PATH_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        elif [ "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" = "/opt/homebrew/bin" ] && ! grep -q '/opt/homebrew/bin' "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+            echo -e "${YELLOW}üìç Adding /opt/homebrew/bin to PATH...${NC}"
+            echo "# Oh My Posh - PATH" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "$PATH_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+            echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        fi
+    fi
+    
+    # Add configuration
+    echo "# Oh My Posh - Theme" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    echo "$INIT_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    
+    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh added to profile${NC}"
+fi
+
+echo -e "\n${GREEN}‚ú® Installation complete!${NC}"
+echo -e "${CYAN}üìã To apply the changes, run:${NC}"
+echo -e "   ${NC}source ${PROFILE_FILE}${NC}"
+echo -e "\n${CYAN}üí° Or close and reopen the terminal${NC}"
```

+# Script para instalar tema Oh My Posh personalizado
+# Autor: GitHub Copilot
+# Data: 2026-01-15
+
+Write-Host "üé® Instalando tema Oh My Posh personalizado..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
+
+# Verificar se Oh My Posh est√° instalado
+Write-Host "üîç Verificando instala√ß√£o do Oh My Posh..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+$ohMyPoshInstalled = Get-Command oh-my-posh -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
+
+if (-not $ohMyPoshInstalled) {
+    Write-Host "‚ùå Oh My Posh n√£o est√° instalado!" -ForegroundColor Red
+    Write-Host "üì¶ Instalando Oh My Posh via winget..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    
+    try {
+        winget install JanDeDobbeleer.OhMyPosh -s winget --accept-package-agreements --accept-source-agreements
+        
+        # Atualizar PATH para a sess√£o atual
+        $env:Path = [System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable("Path","Machine") + ";" + [System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable("Path","User")
+        
+        Write-Host "‚úÖ Oh My Posh instalado com sucesso!" -ForegroundColor Green
+        Write-Host "üí° Voc√™ pode precisar reiniciar o terminal para usar o Oh My Posh" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+    } catch {
+        Write-Host "‚ùå Erro ao instalar Oh My Posh: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
+        Write-Host "üí° Tente instalar manualmente: winget install JanDeDobbeleer.OhMyPosh" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+        exit 1
+    }
+} else {
+    Write-Host "‚úÖ Oh My Posh j√° est√° instalado" -ForegroundColor Green
+    Write-Host "üîÑ Atualizando Oh My Posh..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    
+    try {
+        oh-my-posh upgrade --force
+        Write-Host "‚úÖ Oh My Posh atualizado com sucesso!" -ForegroundColor Green
+    } catch {
+        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  N√£o foi poss√≠vel atualizar, mas continuando com a vers√£o atual" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    }
+}
+
+# Script directory (where the local theme is)
+$scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Path
+$localThemeFile = Join-Path $scriptDir "blocks.emoji.omp.json"
+
+# Oh My Posh themes directory
+$themesPath = "$env:POSH_THEMES_PATH"
+if (-not $themesPath) {
+    $themesPath = "$env:LOCALAPPDATA\Programs\oh-my-posh\themes"
+}
+
+# Theme file name
+$themeName = "blocks.emoji.omp.json"
+$themeFilePath = Join-Path $themesPath $themeName
+
+Write-Host "üìÅ Themes directory: $themesPath" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+
+# Create directory if it doesn't exist
+if (-not (Test-Path $themesPath)) {
+    Write-Host "üìÇ Creating themes directory..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $themesPath -Force | Out-Null
+}
+
+# Copy local theme
+if (Test-Path $localThemeFile) {
+    Write-Host "üìã Copying local theme..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    try {
+        Copy-Item -Path $localThemeFile -Destination $themeFilePath -Force
+        Write-Host "‚úÖ Theme copied successfully: $themeFilePath" -ForegroundColor Green
+    } catch {
+        Write-Host "‚ùå Error copying theme: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
+        exit 1
+    }
+} else {
+    Write-Host "‚ùå Theme file not found: $localThemeFile" -ForegroundColor Red
+    Write-Host "üí° Make sure to run the script from the correct directory" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    exit 1
+}
+
+# Verificar se o profile existe
+if (-not (Test-Path $PROFILE)) {
+    Write-Host "üìù Criando arquivo de profile..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    New-Item -Path $PROFILE -Type File -Force | Out-Null
+    $profileContent = ""
+} else {
+    # Ler o conte√∫do atual do profile
+    $profileContent = Get-Content $PROFILE -Raw -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
+    if (-not $profileContent) {
+        $profileContent = ""
+    }
+}
+
+# Verificar se j√° existe alguma linha oh-my-posh init no profile
+$ohMyPoshPattern = "oh-my-posh\s+init"
+$newInitLine = "oh-my-posh init pwsh --config '$themeFilePath' | Invoke-Expression"
+
+if ($profileContent -match $ohMyPoshPattern) {
+    Write-Host "üîÑ Atualizando configura√ß√£o existente do Oh My Posh no profile..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    
+    # Substituir qualquer linha que contenha "oh-my-posh init"
+    $profileContent = $profileContent -replace ".*oh-my-posh\s+init[^\r\n]*", $newInitLine
+    
+    Set-Content $PROFILE -Value $profileContent -Encoding UTF8
+    Write-Host "‚úÖ Configura√ß√£o do Oh My Posh atualizada no profile" -ForegroundColor Green
+} else {
+    Write-Host "‚ûï Adicionando Oh My Posh ao profile..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    
+    # Adicionar no in√≠cio do profile se n√£o estiver vazio, sen√£o criar
+    if ($profileContent.Trim()) {
+        $profileContent = $newInitLine + "`r`n`r`n" + $profileContent
+    } else {
+        $profileContent = $newInitLine + "`r`n"
+    }
+    
+    Set-Content $PROFILE -Value $profileContent -Encoding UTF8
+    Write-Host "‚úÖ Oh My Posh adicionado ao profile" -ForegroundColor Green
+}
+
+Write-Host "`n‚ú® Instala√ß√£o conclu√≠da!" -ForegroundColor Green
+Write-Host "üìã Para aplicar as mudan√ßas, execute:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+Write-Host "   . `$PROFILE" -ForegroundColor White
+Write-Host "`nüí° Ou feche e reabra o PowerShell" -ForegroundColor Cyan

+YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
+CYAN='\033[0;36m'
+NC='\033[0m' # No Color
+
+echo -e "${CYAN}üé® Installing custom Oh My Posh theme...${NC}"
+
+# Check if Oh My Posh is installed
+echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Checking Oh My Posh installation...${NC}"
+
+if ! command -v oh-my-posh &> /dev/null; then
+    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Oh My Posh is not installed!${NC}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing Oh My Posh...${NC}"
+    
+    # Install Oh My Posh via curl (official method)
+    if curl -s https://ohmyposh.dev/install.sh | bash -s; then
+        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh installed successfully!${NC}"
+        
+        # Add to PATH if needed
+        if [[ ":$PATH:" != *":/usr/local/bin:"* ]]; then
+            export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
+        fi
+        if [[ ":$PATH:" != *":$HOME/.local/bin:"* ]]; then
+            export PATH=$PATH:$HOME/.local/bin
+        fi
+        
+        echo -e "${CYAN}üí° You may need to restart the terminal to use Oh My Posh${NC}"
+    else
+        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error installing Oh My Posh${NC}"
+        echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Try installing manually: curl -s https://ohmyposh.dev/install.sh | bash -s${NC}"
+        exit 1
+    fi
+else
+    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh is already installed${NC}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Updating Oh My Posh...${NC}"
+    
+    if sudo oh-my-posh upgrade --force; then
+        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh updated successfully!${NC}"
+    else
+        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Could not update, but continuing with current version${NC}"
+    fi
+fi
+
+# Script directory (where the local theme is)
+SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
+LOCAL_THEME_FILE="${SCRIPT_DIR}/blocks.emoji.omp.json"
+
+# Oh My Posh themes directory
+THEMES_PATH="${HOME}/.poshthemes"
+
+# Theme file name
+THEME_NAME="blocks.emoji.omp.json"
+THEME_FILE_PATH="${THEMES_PATH}/${THEME_NAME}"
+
+echo -e "${YELLOW}üìÅ Themes directory: ${THEMES_PATH}${NC}"
+
+# Create directory if it doesn't exist
+if [ ! -d "$THEMES_PATH" ]; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìÇ Creating themes directory...${NC}"
+    mkdir -p "$THEMES_PATH"
+fi
+
+# Copy local theme
+if [ -f "$LOCAL_THEME_FILE" ]; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Copying local theme...${NC}"
+    if cp "$LOCAL_THEME_FILE" "$THEME_FILE_PATH"; then
+        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Theme copied successfully: ${THEME_FILE_PATH}${NC}"
+    else
+        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error copying theme${NC}"
+        exit 1
+    fi
+else
+    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Theme file not found: ${LOCAL_THEME_FILE}${NC}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Make sure to run the script from the correct directory${NC}"
+    exit 1
+fi
+
+# Detect shell (bash or zsh)
+SHELL_NAME=$(basename "$SHELL")
+if [ "$SHELL_NAME" = "zsh" ]; then
+    PROFILE_FILE="${HOME}/.zshrc"
+    INIT_COMMAND="eval \"\$(oh-my-posh init zsh --config ${THEME_FILE_PATH})\""
+else
+    PROFILE_FILE="${HOME}/.bashrc"
+    INIT_COMMAND="eval \"\$(oh-my-posh init bash --config ${THEME_FILE_PATH})\""
+fi
+
+echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Configuring profile: ${PROFILE_FILE}${NC}"
+
+# Create profile if it doesn't exist
+if [ ! -f "$PROFILE_FILE" ]; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Creating profile file...${NC}"
+    touch "$PROFILE_FILE"
+fi
+
+# Detect where Oh My Posh is installed
+OMP_INSTALL_DIR=""
+if [ -f "${HOME}/.local/bin/oh-my-posh" ]; then
+    OMP_INSTALL_DIR="${HOME}/.local/bin"
+elif [ -f "/usr/local/bin/oh-my-posh" ]; then
+    OMP_INSTALL_DIR="/usr/local/bin"
+fi
+
+# Command to add to PATH (if needed)
+PATH_COMMAND=""
+if [ -n "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" ] && [ "$OMP_INSTALL_DIR" = "${HOME}/.local/bin" ]; then
+    PATH_COMMAND="export PATH=\"\$HOME/.local/bin:\$PATH\""
+fi
+
+# Check if Oh My Posh configuration already exists
+if grep -q "oh-my-posh init" "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Updating existing Oh My Posh configuration in profile...${NC}"
+    
+    # Remove old oh-my-posh lines
+    sed -i '/oh-my-posh init/d' "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    
+    # Add PATH if needed and not already present
+    if [ -n "$PATH_COMMAND" ] && ! grep -q '\.local/bin' "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìç Adding ~/.local/bin to PATH...${NC}"
+        echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        echo "# Oh My Posh - PATH" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        echo "$PATH_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    fi
+    
+    # Add new configuration
+    echo "$INIT_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    
+    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh configuration updated in profile${NC}"
+else
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ûï Adding Oh My Posh to profile...${NC}"
+    
+    # Add blank line if file is not empty
+    if [ -s "$PROFILE_FILE" ]; then
+        echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    fi
+    
+    # Add PATH if needed and not already present
+    if [ -n "$PATH_COMMAND" ] && ! grep -q '\.local/bin' "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
+        echo -e "${YELLOW}üìç Adding ~/.local/bin to PATH...${NC}"
+        echo "# Oh My Posh - PATH" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        echo "$PATH_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+        echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    fi
+    
+    # Add configuration
+    echo "# Oh My Posh - Theme" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    echo "$INIT_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
+    
+    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh added to profile${NC}"
+fi
+
+echo -e "\n${GREEN}‚ú® Installation complete!${NC}"
+echo -e "${CYAN}üìã To apply the changes, run:${NC}"
+echo -e "   ${NC}source ${PROFILE_FILE}${NC}"
+echo -e "\n${CYAN}üí° Or close and reopen the terminal${NC}"
```

# üîê SSH Scripts

Scripts for generating and managing SSH keys.

## üìã Available Scripts

### `generate-ssh-key.ps1` (Windows)

Generates Ed25519 SSH keys on Windows.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Generates SSH keys using Ed25519 algorithm (more secure and modern)
- ‚úÖ Detects existing keys and offers options
- ‚úÖ Displays the public key for easy copying
- ‚úÖ Creates `.ssh` directory automatically

**Parameters:**
| Parameter | Required | Description |
|-----------|----------|-------------|
| `-Email` | No* | Email to identify the key |
| `-Name` | No* | Key file name |

*If not provided, will be requested interactively.

**Usage:**
```powershell
# Interactive
.\generate-ssh-key.ps1

# With parameters
.\generate-ssh-key.ps1 -Email "your@email.com" -Name "github"
```

**Handling existing keys:**
If a key with the same name already exists, the script offers:
- ‚Ü©Ô∏è **ENTER** - Overwrite the existing key
- ‚úèÔ∏è **New name** - Generate with another name
- ‚õî **"exit"** - Cancel operation

---

### `generate-ssh-key.sh` (Linux/macOS)

Generates Ed25519 SSH keys on Linux and macOS.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Generates SSH keys using Ed25519 algorithm

+# üîê SSH Scripts
+
+Scripts for generating and managing SSH keys.
+
+## üìã Available Scripts
+
+### `generate-ssh-key.ps1` (Windows)
+
+Generates Ed25519 SSH keys on Windows.
+
+**Features:**
+- ‚úÖ Generates SSH keys using Ed25519 algorithm (more secure and modern)
+- ‚úÖ Detects existing keys and offers options
+- ‚úÖ Displays the public key for easy copying
+- ‚úÖ Creates `.ssh` directory automatically
+
+**Parameters:**
+| Parameter | Required | Description |
+|-----------|----------|-------------|
+| `-Email` | No* | Email to identify the key |
+| `-Name` | No* | Key file name |
+
+*If not provided, will be requested interactively.
+
+**Usage:**
+```powershell
+# Interactive
+.\generate-ssh-key.ps1
+
+# With parameters
+.\generate-ssh-key.ps1 -Email "your@email.com" -Name "github"
+```
+
+**Handling existing keys:**
+If a key with the same name already exists, the script offers:
+- ‚Ü©Ô∏è **ENTER** - Overwrite the existing key
+- ‚úèÔ∏è **New name** - Generate with another name
+- ‚õî **"exit"** - Cancel operation
+
+---
+
+### `generate-ssh-key.sh` (Linux/macOS)
+
+Generates Ed25519 SSH keys on Linux and macOS.
+
+**Features:**
+- ‚úÖ Generates SSH keys using Ed25519 algorithm
+- ‚úÖ Detects existing keys and offers options
+- ‚úÖ Displays the public key for easy copying
+- ‚úÖ Creates `.ssh` directory automatically
+
+**Usage:**
+```bash
+# Give execution permission
+chmod +x generate-ssh-key.sh
+
+# Interactive
+./generate-ssh-key.sh
+
+# With parameters
+./generate-ssh-key.sh "your@email.com" "github"
+```
+
+## üí° After generating the key
+
+1. Copy the public key displayed in the terminal
+2. Add it to the desired service:
+   - **GitHub**: Settings ‚Üí SSH and GPG keys ‚Üí New SSH key
+   - **GitLab**: Preferences ‚Üí SSH Keys
+   - **Azure DevOps**: User settings ‚Üí SSH public keys
+   - **Bitbucket**: Personal settings ‚Üí SSH keys
+
+## üîí About Ed25519
+
+The Ed25519 algorithm is recommended because:
+- ‚úÖ More secure than RSA
+- ‚úÖ Smaller and faster keys
+- ‚úÖ Resistant to side-channel attacks
```

diff --git a/_english-version/ssh/generate-ssh-key.ps1 b/_english-version/ssh/generate-ssh-key.ps1
new file mode 100644

+++ b/_english-version/ssh/generate-ssh-key.ps1
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+param(
+    [string]$Email,
+    [string]$Name
+)
+
+# Function to verify and handle existing keys
+function Resolve-ExistingKey {
+    param(
+        [string]$KeyName,
+        [string]$SshDirectory
+    )
+    
+    # Remove "id_" prefix if user typed it
+    if ($KeyName.StartsWith("id_")) {
+        $KeyName = $KeyName.Substring(3)
+    }
+    
+    $KeyPath = Join-Path $SshDirectory "id_$KeyName"
+    
+    # If key doesn't exist, return the name
+    if (-not (Test-Path $KeyPath)) {
+        return $KeyName
+    }
+    
+    # Key exists - display information
+    Write-Host "`n‚ö†Ô∏è  The key '$KeyPath' already exists!" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+    
+    # Display existing public key content
+    $PublicKeyPath = "$KeyPath.pub"
+    if (Test-Path $PublicKeyPath) {
+        Write-Host "`nüìÑ Existing public key content:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+        Get-Content $PublicKeyPath | Write-Host -ForegroundColor White
+    }
+    
+    Write-Host "`nü§î What would you like to do?" -ForegroundColor Gray
+    Write-Host "  ‚Ü©Ô∏è ENTER - Overwrite existing file" -ForegroundColor Gray
+    Write-Host "  ‚úèÔ∏è Type a new name - Generate with another name" -ForegroundColor Gray
+    Write-Host "  ‚õî Type 'exit' or press Ctrl+C to cancel" -ForegroundColor Gray
+    
+    # Capture input
+    Write-Host "`nüëâ Type: "-NoNewline  -ForegroundColor Gray
+    $Response = $Host.UI.ReadLine()
+    
+    if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($Response)) {
+        # ENTER pressed - overwrite
+        Write-Host "`nüîÑ Overwriting existing file..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
+        return $KeyName
+    }
+    elseif ($Response.ToLower() -eq "exit" `
+            -or $Response.ToLower() -eq "e" `
+            -or $Response.ToLower() -eq "quit") {
+        # "exit" typed
+        Write-Host "`n‚ùå Operation cancelled." -ForegroundColor Red
+        exit
+    }
+    else {
+        # New name typed - verify recursively
+        return Resolve-ExistingKey -KeyName $Response -SshDirectory $SshDirectory
+    }
+}
+
+# If email was not provided, request it
+if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($Email)) {
+    $Email = Read-Host "üìß Enter email"
+}
+
+# Extract email prefix
+$EmailPrefix = $Email.Split('@')[0]
+
+# If name was not provided, request it
+if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($Name)) {
+    Write-Host "üîë Enter key name (leave blank to use " -NoNewline  -ForegroundColor Gray
+    Write-Host $EmailPrefix -ForegroundColor Yellow -NoNewline
+    Write-Host "): " -NoNewline  -ForegroundColor Gray
+    $Name = Read-Host
+}
+
+# If name is blank, use email prefix
+if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($Name)) {
+    $Name = $EmailPrefix
+    Write-Host "‚ú® Using '" -ForegroundColor Gray -NoNewline
+	Write-Host $EmailPrefix -ForegroundColor Yellow -NoNewline
+	Write-Host "' as key name (extracted from email)"  -ForegroundColor Gray
+}
+
+# Remove "id_" prefix if user typed it
+if ($Name.StartsWith("id_")) {
+    $Name = $Name.Substring(3)
+    Write-Host "üìå Removed duplicate 'id_' prefix. Using: $Name" -ForegroundColor Yellow
+}
+
+# Build complete file path (always in ~/.ssh)
+$SshDir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE ".ssh"
+if (-not (Test-Path $SshDir)) {
+    New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $SshDir -Force | Out-Null
+    Write-Host "üìÅ .ssh directory created at: $SshDir" -ForegroundColor Green
+}
+
+# Verify and resolve key name (handling duplicates)
+$Name = Resolve-ExistingKey -KeyName $Name -SshDirectory $SshDir
+$KeyPath = Join-Path $SshDir "id_$Name"
+
+Write-Host "`nüîê Generating SSH key id_$Name" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+Write-Host "üìù ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C `"$Email`" -f `"$KeyPath`" -N `"`"`n" -ForegroundColor White
+
+# Execute ssh-keygen (with empty passphrase and overwrite without asking)
+echo y | ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C $Email -f $KeyPath -N ""
+
+# Verify if key was generated successfully
+if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
+    Write-Host "`n=================================" -ForegroundColor Green
+    Write-Host "‚úÖ SSH key generated successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
+    Write-Host "=================================" -ForegroundColor Green
+    
+    # Display public key content
+    $PublicKeyPath = "$KeyPath.pub"
+    
+    if (Test-Path $PublicKeyPath) {
+        Write-Host "`nüìã Public key content (copy the text below):" -ForegroundColor Cyan
+        Get-Content $PublicKeyPath | Write-Host -ForegroundColor White
+    } else {
+        Write-Host "`n‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: Could not find public key file at: $PublicKeyPath" -ForegroundColor Red
+    }
+} else {
+    Write-Host "`n‚ùå Error generating SSH key!" -ForegroundColor Red
+}

+#!/bin/bash
+
+# ANSI Colors
+YELLOW='\033[33m'
+CYAN='\033[36m'
+WHITE='\033[37m'
+GRAY='\033[90m'
+GREEN='\033[32m'
+RED='\033[31m'
+RESET='\033[0m'
+
+# Function to verify and handle existing keys
+resolve_existing_key() {
+    local key_name="$1"
+    local ssh_directory="$2"
+    
+    # Remove "id_" prefix if user typed it
+    if [[ "$key_name" == id_* ]]; then
+        key_name="${key_name:3}"
+    fi
+    
+    local key_path="$ssh_directory/id_$key_name"
+    
+    # If key doesn't exist, return the name
+    if [[ ! -f "$key_path" ]]; then
+        echo "$key_name"
+        return
+    fi
+    
+    # Key exists - display information
+    echo -e "\n${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  The key '$key_path' already exists!${RESET}"
+    
+    # Display existing public key content
+    local public_key_path="$key_path.pub"
+    if [[ -f "$public_key_path" ]]; then
+        echo -e "\n${CYAN}üìÑ Existing public key content:${RESET}"
+        echo -e "${WHITE}$(cat "$public_key_path")${RESET}"
+    fi
+    
+    echo -e "\n${GRAY}ü§î What would you like to do?${RESET}"
+    echo -e "${GRAY}  ‚Ü©Ô∏è ENTER - Overwrite existing file${RESET}"
+    echo -e "${GRAY}  ‚úèÔ∏è Type a new name - Generate with another name${RESET}"
+    echo -e "${GRAY}  ‚õî Type 'exit' or press Ctrl+C to cancel${RESET}"
+    
+    # Capture input
+    echo -en "\n${GRAY}üëâ Type: ${RESET}"
+    read -r response
+    
+    if [[ -z "$response" ]]; then
+        # ENTER pressed - overwrite
+        echo -e "\n${YELLOW}üîÑ Overwriting existing file...${RESET}"
+        echo "$key_name"
+        return
+    fi
+    
+    # Convert to lowercase
+    local response_lower=$(echo "$response" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
+    
+    if [[ "$response_lower" == "exit" ]] || [[ "$response_lower" == "e" ]] || [[ "$response_lower" == "quit" ]]; then
+        # "exit" typed
+        echo -e "\n${RED}‚ùå Operation cancelled.${RESET}"
+        exit 0
+    else
+        # New name typed - verify recursively
+        resolve_existing_key "$response" "$ssh_directory"
+    fi
+}
+
+# Parameters
+email="$1"
+name="$2"
+
+# If email was not provided, request it
+if [[ -z "$email" ]]; then
+    echo -n "üìß Enter email: "
+    read -r email
+fi
+
+# Extract email prefix
+email_prefix="${email%%@*}"
+
+# If name was not provided, request it
+if [[ -z "$name" ]]; then
+    echo -en "${GRAY}üîë Enter key name (leave blank to use ${RESET}"
+    echo -en "${YELLOW}$email_prefix${RESET}"
+    echo -en "${GRAY}): ${RESET}"
+    read -r name
+fi
+
+# If name is blank, use email prefix
+if [[ -z "$name" ]]; then
+    name="$email_prefix"
+    echo -e "${GRAY}‚ú® Using '${RESET}${YELLOW}$email_prefix${RESET}${GRAY}' as key name (extracted from email)${RESET}"
+fi
+
+# Remove "id_" prefix if user typed it
+if [[ "$name" == id_* ]]; then
+    name="${name:3}"
+    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìå Removed duplicate 'id_' prefix. Using: $name${RESET}"
+fi
+
+# Build complete file path (always in ~/.ssh)
+ssh_dir="$HOME/.ssh"
+if [[ ! -d "$ssh_dir" ]]; then
+    mkdir -p "$ssh_dir"
+    echo -e "${GREEN}üìÅ .ssh directory created at: $ssh_dir${RESET}"
+fi
+
+# Verify and resolve key name (handling duplicates)
+name=$(resolve_existing_key "$name" "$ssh_dir")
+key_path="$ssh_dir/id_$name"
+
+echo -e "\n${CYAN}üîê Generating SSH key id_$name${RESET}"
+echo -e "${WHITE}üìù ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C \"$email\" -f \"$key_path\" -N \"\"\n${RESET}"
+
+# Execute ssh-keygen (with empty passphrase and overwrite without asking)
+yes y 2>/dev/null | ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "$email" -f "$key_path" -N ""
+
+# Verify if key was generated successfully
+if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
+    echo -e "\n${GREEN}=================================${RESET}"
+    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ SSH key generated successfully!${RESET}"
+    echo -e "${GREEN}=================================${RESET}"
+    
+    # Display public key content
+    public_key_path="$key_path.pub"
+    
+    if [[ -f "$public_key_path" ]]; then
+        echo -e "\n${CYAN}üìã Public key content (copy the text below):${RESET}"
+        echo -e "${WHITE}$(cat "$public_key_path")${RESET}"
+    else
+        echo -e "\n${RED}‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: Could not find public key file at: $public_key_path${RESET}"
+    fi
+else
+    echo -e "\n${RED}‚ùå Error generating SSH key!${RESET}"
+fi
```

summary.text:
<analysis>
## Chronological Review
1. **Initial Request (Feb 3)**: User asked to rename `.english-version` folder to `_english-version` and update all references including submodules
2. **Folder Rename Completed**: Successfully renamed folder and updated 35+ references across multiple files
3. **Second Request (Feb 4)**: User requested renaming gitmodules:
   - `.github` ‚Üí `.copilot-core`
   - `.github-project` ‚Üí `.copilot-project`
   - Move both into `.github/` folder structure: `{ROOT}/.github/.copilot-core` and `{ROOT}/.github/.copilot-project`
4. **Submodule Migration**: Updated `.gitmodules`, moved submodules, and updated 88+ references across all files
5. **Current Request (Feb 5)**: User wants `.copilot-core` to be **agnostic** - it should NOT know about specific project skills, memories, and contexts. It should only know:
   - That `.copilot-project` exists
   - That there's an `instructions` file in `.copilot-project` to call for project info
   - The standard folder structure all projects must have

## Intent Mapping
- **Original goal**: Rename folders and update references
- **Architectural goal**: Make `.copilot-core` completely reusable/generic across any project
- **Current focus**: Remove project-specific references from `.copilot-core` files, make it agnostic

## Technical Inventory
- **Repository**: `d:\Repos\_pm\scripts`
- **Submodules**:
  - `.github/.copilot-core/` - Core reusable agent (should be agnostic)
  - `.github/.copilot-project/` - Project-specific rules and skills
- **Key files in `.copilot-core`**:
  - `instructions/default.instructions.md` - Main aggregator
  - `initial.md`, `workflow-engine.md`, `skills-system.md`, `todo-workflow.md`
  - `skills/`: `memory.md`, `context.md`, `create-skill.md`, `project-analyzer.md`, `project-setup.md`

## Code Archaeology
Files with project-specific references that need to be made agnostic:
1. `default.instructions.md` - Contains hardcoded references to `bash.md`, `powershell.md`, `readme.md`, `sync.md`, `skills-catalog.md`, `update-structure.md`
2. `skills-system.md` - References `.copilot-project/memory/` and `/context/`
3. `skills/memory.md` - References project-specific paths
4. `skills/context.md` - References project-specific paths
5. `skills/project-setup.md` - References project-specific structure
6. `skills/project-analyzer.md` - References project-specific creation

## Progress Assessment
**Completed**:
- ‚úÖ Renamed `.english-version` to `_english-version` with all references
- ‚úÖ Renamed submodules to `.copilot-core` and `.copilot-project`
- ‚úÖ Moved submodules under `.github/` folder
- ‚úÖ Updated 88+ references across all files

**Pending**:
- ‚è≥ Make `.copilot-core` agnostic (remove project-specific knowledge)
- ‚è≥ Create proper delegation to `.copilot-project/instructions` for project-specific info

## Recent Commands Analysis
The most recent tool call before summarization was `read_file` on:
- **File**: `d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\.github\.copilot-core\instructions\default.instructions.md`
- **Lines**: 1-200
- **Result**: Full content of the main instruction file showing all the project-specific references that need to be removed, including:
  - Hardcoded skill paths: `bash.md`, `powershell.md`, `readme.md`, `sync.md`
  - Direct references to `skills-catalog.md`
  - Specific file detection workflows with project-specific actions

The agent was about to begin refactoring `default.instructions.md` to make it agnostic when summarization was triggered.
</analysis>

<summary>
## 1. Conversation Overview
- **Primary Objectives**: 
  1. "renomeie a pasta .english-version para _english-version e ajuste todas as refer√™ncias (inclusive nos submodules)"
  2. "os gitmodules foram renomeados conforme abaixo .github -> .copilot-core, .github-project -> .copilot-project" and move into `.github/` folder
  3. Current: Make `.copilot-core` agnostic - "o submodule .copilot n√£o conhece as skills, memories e contexts existentes no .copilot-project. ele s√≥ sabe que existe o .copilot-project e que deve existir um instructions no .copilot-project"
- **Session Context**: Multi-phase refactoring of prompt/instruction architecture for a scripts automation project. Started with folder renames, evolved into major architectural separation between core (reusable) and project (specific) components.
- **User Intent Evolution**: From simple rename ‚Üí structural reorganization ‚Üí now architectural separation to make core completely agnostic and reusable

## 2. Technical Foundation
- **Repository**: `d:\Repos\_pm\scripts` - Scripts automation collection (Docker, SSH, Oh My Posh, Azure, etc.)
- **Git Submodules**: 
  - `.github/.copilot-core/` (from `pdmartins/.github.git`, branch: main) - Core reusable agent
  - `.github/.copilot-project/` (from `pdmartins/.github-project.git`, branch: scripts) - Project-specific
- **Architecture Pattern**: Workflow Engine with Skills system - skills loaded on-demand based on file context
- **Language Rule**: Chat in PT-BR, code in English

## 3. Codebase Status
- **`.github/.copilot-core/instructions/default.instructions.md`**:
  - Purpose: Main aggregator that loads core + project instructions
  - Current State: Contains project-specific references that violate agnostic principle
  - Key Issue: Lines 57-62 hardcode project-specific skills (bash.md, powershell.md, etc.)
  - Lines 67-80 reference project-specific files directly

- **`.github/.copilot-core/skills/memory.md`**:
  - Purpose: Manage lessons and historical decisions
  - Current State: References `.github/.copilot-project/memory/` paths
  - Needs: Generic references to project structure

- **`.github/.copilot-core/skills/context.md`**:
  - Purpose: Manage current project state
  - Current State: References `.github/.copilot-project/context/` paths
  - Needs: Generic delegation to project instructions

- **`.github/.copilot-project/`**:
  - Contains: `initial.md`, `conventions.md`, `cross-platform.md`, `english-version.md`
  - Skills folder: `bash.md`, `powershell.md`, `readme.md`, `sync.md`, `update-structure.md`
  - Memory/Context folders with `lessons-learned.md` and `project.md`

## 4. Problem Resolution
- **Issues Encountered**: 
  - 88+ file references needed updating during submodule migration
  - Submodules showed as "dirty" after internal file changes
- **Solutions Implemented**: 
  - Used `git mv` for folder rename to preserve history
  - Used `multi_replace_string_in_file` for bulk updates
- **Current Challenge**: `.copilot-core` contains hardcoded project-specific knowledge that breaks reusability

## 5. Progress Tracking
- **Completed Tasks**:
  - ‚úÖ Renamed `.english-version` ‚Üí `_english-version` (35+ references updated)
  - ‚úÖ Renamed submodules (`.github` ‚Üí `.copilot-core`, `.github-project` ‚Üí `.copilot-project`)
  - ‚úÖ Moved submodules into `.github/` folder structure
  - ‚úÖ Updated `.gitmodules` configuration
  - ‚úÖ Updated `.vscode/settings.json` (vsicons, commit-prompt path)
  - ‚úÖ Updated all internal references (88+ matches across files)

- **Partially Complete Work**:
  - ‚è≥ Making `.copilot-core` agnostic (just started analyzing)

## 6. Active Work State
- **Current Focus**: Refactoring `.copilot-core` to be completely agnostic/reusable
- **Recent Context**: User clarified the architectural intent - core should ONLY know:
  1. That `.copilot-project` exists
  2. That an instruction file in `.copilot-project` provides project info
  3. The standard folder structure (skills/, memory/, context/)
- **Immediate Context**: Agent just read `default.instructions.md` to identify all project-specific references that need to be removed/generalized

## 7. Recent Operations
- **Last Agent Commands**: `read_file` on `default.instructions.md` (lines 1-200)
- **Tool Results Summary**: File content shows extensive project-specific hardcoding:
  - `<skill-loading>` section (lines 57-62): Hardcodes `bash.md`, `powershell.md`, `readme.md`, `sync.md`
  - `<skill-discovery>` section (lines 64-75): References `skills-catalog.md`

<attachments>
<attachment id="commit-prompt.md" filePath="d:\\Repos\\_pm\\scripts\\.github\\.copilot-core\\.source-control\\commit-prompt.md">
# Commit Message Instructions

## Format

Single line only, using Conventional Commits:

```
<type>(<scope>): <description>
```

## Types (required)

- `feat`: New feature
- `fix`: Bug fix
- `docs`: Documentation only
- `style`: Formatting, missing semicolons, etc.
- `refactor`: Code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature
- `perf`: Performance improvement
- `test`: Adding or updating tests
- `chore`: Maintenance tasks, dependencies, configs
- `ci`: CI/CD changes
- `build`: Build system or external dependencies

## Rules

1. Always include a type - it is mandatory
2. Single line only - no body or footer
3. Use imperative mood ("add" not "added")
4. Don't capitalize the first letter of description
5. No period at the end
6. Keep under 72 characters total
7. Scope is optional but recommended
8. Write in English

## Examples

```
feat(auth): add JWT token refresh endpoint
fix(database): resolve connection timeout issue
docs(readme): update installation instructions
chore(deps): upgrade to .NET 9
refactor(api): simplify error handling logic
```
</attachment>

</attachments>
